cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of information spreading in a distributed network, which is a core topic in Distributed Computing (cs.DC). The Vertex-Congest model is a well-known model in this area. The paper also discusses the impact of failures on the information spreading problem, which is a common concern in Networked Systems (cs.NI). The paper proposes a randomized algorithm that makes dynamic message choices, which involves probabilistic analysis and optimization, making it relevant to Stochastic Processes (cs.SI) and Optimization and Control (cs.DS). Finally, the paper deals with the transmission of messages in a network, which is a topic in Information Theory (cs.IT).
